026/** Provide access to the network communication data to / from the Driver Station. */
027public final class DriverStation {
028  /** Number of Joystick Ports. */
029  public static final int kJoystickPorts = 6;
030
031  private static class HALJoystickButtons {
032    public int m_buttons;
033    public byte m_count;
034  }
035
036  private static class HALJoystickAxes {
037    public float[] m_axes;
038    public short m_count;
039
040    HALJoystickAxes(int count) {
041      m_axes = new float[count];
042    }
043  }
044
045  private static class HALJoystickPOVs {
046    public short[] m_povs;
047    public short m_count;
048
049    HALJoystickPOVs(int count) {
050      m_povs = new short[count];
051      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
052        m_povs[i] = -1;
053      }
054    }
055  }
056
057  /** The robot alliance that the robot is a part of. */
058  public enum Alliance {
059    Red,
060    Blue,
061    Invalid
062  }
063
064  public enum MatchType {
065    None,
066    Practice,
067    Qualification,
068    Elimination
069  }
070
071  private static final double JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL = 1.0;
072  private static double m_nextMessageTime;
073
074  private static class DriverStationTask implements Runnable {
075    DriverStationTask() {}
076
077    @Override
078    public void run() {
079      DriverStation.run();
080    }
081  } /* DriverStationTask */
082
083  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
084  private static class MatchDataSender {
085    NetworkTable table;
086    NetworkTableEntry typeMetadata;
087    NetworkTableEntry gameSpecificMessage;
088    NetworkTableEntry eventName;
089    NetworkTableEntry matchNumber;
090    NetworkTableEntry replayNumber;
091    NetworkTableEntry matchType;
092    NetworkTableEntry alliance;
093    NetworkTableEntry station;
094    NetworkTableEntry controlWord;
095    boolean oldIsRedAlliance = true;
096    int oldStationNumber = 1;
097    String oldEventName = "";
098    String oldGameSpecificMessage = "";
099    int oldMatchNumber;
100    int oldReplayNumber;
101    int oldMatchType;
102    int oldControlWord;
103
104    MatchDataSender() {
105      table = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable("FMSInfo");
106      typeMetadata = table.getEntry(".type");
107      typeMetadata.forceSetString("FMSInfo");
108      gameSpecificMessage = table.getEntry("GameSpecificMessage");
109      gameSpecificMessage.forceSetString("");
110      eventName = table.getEntry("EventName");
111      eventName.forceSetString("");
112      matchNumber = table.getEntry("MatchNumber");
113      matchNumber.forceSetDouble(0);
114      replayNumber = table.getEntry("ReplayNumber");
115      replayNumber.forceSetDouble(0);
116      matchType = table.getEntry("MatchType");
117      matchType.forceSetDouble(0);
118      alliance = table.getEntry("IsRedAlliance");
119      alliance.forceSetBoolean(true);
120      station = table.getEntry("StationNumber");
121      station.forceSetDouble(1);
122      controlWord = table.getEntry("FMSControlData");
123      controlWord.forceSetDouble(0);
124    }
125
126    private void sendMatchData() {
127      AllianceStationID allianceID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
128      boolean isRedAlliance = false;
129      int stationNumber = 1;
130      switch (allianceID) {
131        case Blue1:
132          isRedAlliance = false;
133          stationNumber = 1;
134          break;
135        case Blue2:
136          isRedAlliance = false;
137          stationNumber = 2;
138          break;
139        case Blue3:
140          isRedAlliance = false;
141          stationNumber = 3;
142          break;
143        case Red1:
144          isRedAlliance = true;
145          stationNumber = 1;
146          break;
147        case Red2:
148          isRedAlliance = true;
149          stationNumber = 2;
150          break;
151        default:
152          isRedAlliance = true;
153          stationNumber = 3;
154          break;
155      }
156
157      String currentEventName;
158      String currentGameSpecificMessage;
159      int currentMatchNumber;
160      int currentReplayNumber;
161      int currentMatchType;
162      int currentControlWord;
163      m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
164      try {
165        currentEventName = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.eventName;
166        currentGameSpecificMessage = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.gameSpecificMessage;
167        currentMatchNumber = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.matchNumber;
168        currentReplayNumber = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.replayNumber;
169        currentMatchType = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.matchType;
170      } finally {
171        m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
172      }
173      currentControlWord = HAL.nativeGetControlWord();
174
175      if (oldIsRedAlliance != isRedAlliance) {
176        alliance.setBoolean(isRedAlliance);
177        oldIsRedAlliance = isRedAlliance;
178      }
179      if (oldStationNumber != stationNumber) {
180        station.setDouble(stationNumber);
181        oldStationNumber = stationNumber;
182      }
183      if (!oldEventName.equals(currentEventName)) {
184        eventName.setString(currentEventName);
185        oldEventName = currentEventName;
186      }
187      if (!oldGameSpecificMessage.equals(currentGameSpecificMessage)) {
188        gameSpecificMessage.setString(currentGameSpecificMessage);
189        oldGameSpecificMessage = currentGameSpecificMessage;
190      }
191      if (currentMatchNumber != oldMatchNumber) {
192        matchNumber.setDouble(currentMatchNumber);
193        oldMatchNumber = currentMatchNumber;
194      }
195      if (currentReplayNumber != oldReplayNumber) {
196        replayNumber.setDouble(currentReplayNumber);
197        oldReplayNumber = currentReplayNumber;
198      }
199      if (currentMatchType != oldMatchType) {
200        matchType.setDouble(currentMatchType);
201        oldMatchType = currentMatchType;
202      }
203      if (currentControlWord != oldControlWord) {
204        controlWord.setDouble(currentControlWord);
205        oldControlWord = currentControlWord;
206      }
207    }
208  }
209
210  private static class JoystickLogSender {
211    JoystickLogSender(DataLog log, int stick, long timestamp) {
212      m_stick = stick;
213
214      m_logButtons = new BooleanArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/buttons", timestamp);
215      m_logAxes = new FloatArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/axes", timestamp);
216      m_logPOVs = new IntegerArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/povs", timestamp);
217
218      appendButtons(timestamp);
219      appendAxes(timestamp);
220      appendPOVs(timestamp);
221    }
222
223    public void send(long timestamp) {
224      if (m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_count != m_joystickButtons[m_stick].m_count
225          || m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_buttons != m_joystickButtons[m_stick].m_buttons) {
226        appendButtons(timestamp);
227      }
228
229      if (m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_count != m_joystickAxes[m_stick].m_count) {
230        appendAxes(timestamp);
231      } else {
232        int count = m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_count;
233        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
234          if (m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_axes[i] != m_joystickAxes[m_stick].m_axes[i]) {
235            appendAxes(timestamp);
236            break;
237          }
238        }
239      }
240
241      if (m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_count != m_joystickPOVs[m_stick].m_count) {
242        appendPOVs(timestamp);
243      } else {
244        int count = m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_count;
245        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
246          if (m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_povs[i] != m_joystickPOVs[m_stick].m_povs[i]) {
247            appendPOVs(timestamp);
248            break;
249          }
250        }
251      }
252    }
253
254    void appendButtons(long timestamp) {
255      int count = m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_count;
256      if (m_sizedButtons == null || m_sizedButtons.length != count) {
257        m_sizedButtons = new boolean[count];
258      }
259      int buttons = m_joystickButtonsCache[m_stick].m_buttons;
260      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
261        m_sizedButtons[i] = (buttons & (1 << i)) != 0;
262      }
263      m_logButtons.append(m_sizedButtons, timestamp);
264    }
265
266    void appendAxes(long timestamp) {
267      int count = m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_count;
268      if (m_sizedAxes == null || m_sizedAxes.length != count) {
269        m_sizedAxes = new float[count];
270      }
271      System.arraycopy(m_joystickAxesCache[m_stick].m_axes, 0, m_sizedAxes, 0, count);
272      m_logAxes.append(m_sizedAxes, timestamp);
273    }
274
275    void appendPOVs(long timestamp) {
276      int count = m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_count;
277      if (m_sizedPOVs == null || m_sizedPOVs.length != count) {
278        m_sizedPOVs = new long[count];
279      }
280      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
281        m_sizedPOVs[i] = m_joystickPOVsCache[m_stick].m_povs[i];
282      }
283      m_logPOVs.append(m_sizedPOVs, timestamp);
284    }
285
286    final int m_stick;
287    boolean[] m_sizedButtons;
288    float[] m_sizedAxes;
289    long[] m_sizedPOVs;
290    final BooleanArrayLogEntry m_logButtons;
291    final FloatArrayLogEntry m_logAxes;
292    final IntegerArrayLogEntry m_logPOVs;
293  }
294
295  private static class DataLogSender {
296    DataLogSender(DataLog log, boolean logJoysticks, long timestamp) {
297      m_logEnabled = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:enabled", timestamp);
298      m_logAutonomous = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:autonomous", timestamp);
299      m_logTest = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:test", timestamp);
300      m_logEstop = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:estop", timestamp);
301
302      // append initial control word values
303      m_wasEnabled = m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
304      m_wasAutonomous = m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
305      m_wasTest = m_controlWordCache.getTest();
306      m_wasEstop = m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
307
308      m_logEnabled.append(m_wasEnabled, timestamp);
309      m_logAutonomous.append(m_wasAutonomous, timestamp);
310      m_logTest.append(m_wasTest, timestamp);
311      m_logEstop.append(m_wasEstop, timestamp);
312
313      if (logJoysticks) {
314        m_joysticks = new JoystickLogSender[kJoystickPorts];
315        for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
316          m_joysticks[i] = new JoystickLogSender(log, i, timestamp);
317        }
318      } else {
319        m_joysticks = new JoystickLogSender[0];
320      }
321    }
322
323    public void send(long timestamp) {
324      // append control word value changes
325      boolean enabled = m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
326      if (enabled != m_wasEnabled) {
327        m_logEnabled.append(enabled, timestamp);
328      }
329      m_wasEnabled = enabled;
330
331      boolean autonomous = m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
332      if (autonomous != m_wasAutonomous) {
333        m_logAutonomous.append(autonomous, timestamp);
334      }
335      m_wasAutonomous = autonomous;
336
337      boolean test = m_controlWordCache.getTest();
338      if (test != m_wasTest) {
339        m_logTest.append(test, timestamp);
340      }
341      m_wasTest = test;
342
343      boolean estop = m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
344      if (estop != m_wasEstop) {
345        m_logEstop.append(estop, timestamp);
346      }
347      m_wasEstop = estop;
348
349      // append joystick value changes
350      for (JoystickLogSender joystick : m_joysticks) {
351        joystick.send(timestamp);
352      }
353    }
354
355    boolean m_wasEnabled;
356    boolean m_wasAutonomous;
357    boolean m_wasTest;
358    boolean m_wasEstop;
359    final BooleanLogEntry m_logEnabled;
360    final BooleanLogEntry m_logAutonomous;
361    final BooleanLogEntry m_logTest;
362    final BooleanLogEntry m_logEstop;
363
364    final JoystickLogSender[] m_joysticks;
365  }
366
367  // Joystick User Data
368  private static HALJoystickAxes[] m_joystickAxes = new HALJoystickAxes[kJoystickPorts];
369  private static HALJoystickPOVs[] m_joystickPOVs = new HALJoystickPOVs[kJoystickPorts];
370  private static HALJoystickButtons[] m_joystickButtons = new HALJoystickButtons[kJoystickPorts];
371  private static MatchInfoData m_matchInfo = new MatchInfoData();
372
373  // Joystick Cached Data
374  private static HALJoystickAxes[] m_joystickAxesCache = new HALJoystickAxes[kJoystickPorts];
375  private static HALJoystickPOVs[] m_joystickPOVsCache = new HALJoystickPOVs[kJoystickPorts];
376  private static HALJoystickButtons[] m_joystickButtonsCache =
377      new HALJoystickButtons[kJoystickPorts];
378  private static MatchInfoData m_matchInfoCache = new MatchInfoData();
379
380  // Joystick button rising/falling edge flags
381  private static int[] m_joystickButtonsPressed = new int[kJoystickPorts];
382  private static int[] m_joystickButtonsReleased = new int[kJoystickPorts];
383
384  // preallocated byte buffer for button count
385  private static final ByteBuffer m_buttonCountBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(1);
386
387  private static final MatchDataSender m_matchDataSender;
388  private static DataLogSender m_dataLogSender;
389
390  // Internal Driver Station thread
391  private static Thread m_thread;
392
393  private static volatile boolean m_threadKeepAlive = true;
394
395  private static final ReentrantLock m_cacheDataMutex = new ReentrantLock();
396
397  private static final Lock m_waitForDataMutex;
398  private static final Condition m_waitForDataCond;
399  private static int m_waitForDataCount;
400  private static final ThreadLocal<Integer> m_lastCount = ThreadLocal.withInitial(() -> 0);
401
402  private static boolean m_silenceJoystickWarning;
403
404  // Robot state status variables
405  private static boolean m_userInDisabled;
406  private static boolean m_userInAutonomous;
407  private static boolean m_userInTeleop;
408  private static boolean m_userInTest;
409
410  // Control word variables
411  private static final ReentrantLock m_controlWordMutex = new ReentrantLock();
412  private static final ControlWord m_controlWordCache;
413  private static long m_lastControlWordUpdate;
414
415  /**
416   * DriverStation constructor.
417   *
418   * <p>The single DriverStation instance is created statically with the instance static member
419   * variable.
420   */
421  private DriverStation() {}
422
423  static {
424    HAL.initialize(500, 0);
425    m_waitForDataCount = 0;
426    m_waitForDataMutex = new ReentrantLock();
427    m_waitForDataCond = m_waitForDataMutex.newCondition();
428
429    for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
430      m_joystickButtons[i] = new HALJoystickButtons();
431      m_joystickAxes[i] = new HALJoystickAxes(HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes);
432      m_joystickPOVs[i] = new HALJoystickPOVs(HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
433
434      m_joystickButtonsCache[i] = new HALJoystickButtons();
435      m_joystickAxesCache[i] = new HALJoystickAxes(HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes);
436      m_joystickPOVsCache[i] = new HALJoystickPOVs(HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
437    }
438
439    m_controlWordCache = new ControlWord();
440    m_lastControlWordUpdate = 0;
441
442    m_matchDataSender = new MatchDataSender();
443
444    m_thread = new Thread(new DriverStationTask(), "FRCDriverStation");
445    m_thread.setPriority((Thread.NORM_PRIORITY + Thread.MAX_PRIORITY) / 2);
446
447    m_thread.start();
448  }
449
450  /** Kill the thread. */
451  public static synchronized void release() {
452    m_threadKeepAlive = false;
453    if (m_thread != null) {
454      try {
455        m_thread.join();
456      } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
457        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
458      }
459      m_thread = null;
460    }
461  }
462
463  /**
464   * Report error to Driver Station. Optionally appends Stack trace to error message.
465   *
466   * @param error The error to report.
467   * @param printTrace If true, append stack trace to error string
468   */
469  public static void reportError(String error, boolean printTrace) {
470    reportErrorImpl(true, 1, error, printTrace);
471  }
472
473  /**
474   * Report error to Driver Station. Appends provided stack trace to error message.
475   *
476   * @param error The error to report.
477   * @param stackTrace The stack trace to append
478   */
479  public static void reportError(String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
480    reportErrorImpl(true, 1, error, stackTrace);
481  }
482
483  /**
484   * Report warning to Driver Station. Optionally appends Stack trace to warning message.
485   *
486   * @param warning The warning to report.
487   * @param printTrace If true, append stack trace to warning string
488   */
489  public static void reportWarning(String warning, boolean printTrace) {
490    reportErrorImpl(false, 1, warning, printTrace);
491  }
492
493  /**
494   * Report warning to Driver Station. Appends provided stack trace to warning message.
495   *
496   * @param warning The warning to report.
497   * @param stackTrace The stack trace to append
498   */
499  public static void reportWarning(String warning, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
500    reportErrorImpl(false, 1, warning, stackTrace);
501  }
502
503  private static void reportErrorImpl(boolean isError, int code, String error, boolean printTrace) {
504    reportErrorImpl(isError, code, error, printTrace, Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace(), 3);
505  }
506
507  private static void reportErrorImpl(
508      boolean isError, int code, String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
509    reportErrorImpl(isError, code, error, true, stackTrace, 0);
510  }
511
512  private static void reportErrorImpl(
513      boolean isError,
514      int code,
515      String error,
516      boolean printTrace,
517      StackTraceElement[] stackTrace,
518      int stackTraceFirst) {
519    String locString;
520    if (stackTrace.length >= stackTraceFirst + 1) {
521      locString = stackTrace[stackTraceFirst].toString();
522    } else {
523      locString = "";
524    }
525    StringBuilder traceString = new StringBuilder();
526    if (printTrace) {
527      boolean haveLoc = false;
528      for (int i = stackTraceFirst; i < stackTrace.length; i++) {
529        String loc = stackTrace[i].toString();
530        traceString.append("\tat ").append(loc).append('\n');
531        // get first user function
532        if (!haveLoc && !loc.startsWith("edu.wpi.first")) {
533          locString = loc;
534          haveLoc = true;
535        }
536      }
537    }
538    HAL.sendError(isError, code, false, error, locString, traceString.toString(), true);
539  }
540
541  /**
542   * The state of one joystick button. Button indexes begin at 1.
543   *
544   * @param stick The joystick to read.
545   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
546   * @return The state of the joystick button.
547   */
548  public static boolean getStickButton(final int stick, final int button) {
549    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
550      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
551    }
552    if (button <= 0) {
553      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
554      return false;
555    }
556
557    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
558    try {
559      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
560        return (m_joystickButtons[stick].m_buttons & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0;
561      }
562    } finally {
563      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
564    }
565
566    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
567        "Joystick Button "
568            + button
569            + " on port "
570            + stick
571            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
572    return false;
573  }
574
575  /**
576   * Whether one joystick button was pressed since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
577   *
578   * @param stick The joystick to read.
579   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
580   * @return Whether the joystick button was pressed since the last check.
581   */
582  public static boolean getStickButtonPressed(final int stick, final int button) {
583    if (button <= 0) {
584      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
585      return false;
586    }
587    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
588      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
589    }
590
591    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
592    try {
593      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
594        // If button was pressed, clear flag and return true
595        if ((m_joystickButtonsPressed[stick] & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0) {
596          m_joystickButtonsPressed[stick] &= ~(1 << (button - 1));
597          return true;
598        } else {
599          return false;
600        }
601      }
602    } finally {
603      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
604    }
605
606    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
607        "Joystick Button "
608            + button
609            + " on port "
610            + stick
611            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
612    return false;
613  }
614
615  /**
616   * Whether one joystick button was released since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
617   *
618   * @param stick The joystick to read.
619   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
620   * @return Whether the joystick button was released since the last check.
621   */
622  public static boolean getStickButtonReleased(final int stick, final int button) {
623    if (button <= 0) {
624      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
625      return false;
626    }
627    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
628      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
629    }
630
631    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
632    try {
633      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
634        // If button was released, clear flag and return true
635        if ((m_joystickButtonsReleased[stick] & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0) {
636          m_joystickButtonsReleased[stick] &= ~(1 << (button - 1));
637          return true;
638        } else {
639          return false;
640        }
641      }
642    } finally {
643      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
644    }
645
646    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
647        "Joystick Button "
648            + button
649            + " on port "
650            + stick
651            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
652    return false;
653  }
654
655  /**
656   * Get the value of the axis on a joystick. This depends on the mapping of the joystick connected
657   * to the specified port.
658   *
659   * @param stick The joystick to read.
660   * @param axis The analog axis value to read from the joystick.
661   * @return The value of the axis on the joystick.
662   */
663  public static double getStickAxis(int stick, int axis) {
664    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
665      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
666    }
667    if (axis < 0 || axis >= HAL.kMaxJoystickAxes) {
668      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick axis is out of range");
669    }
670
671    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
672    try {
673      if (axis < m_joystickAxes[stick].m_count) {
674        return m_joystickAxes[stick].m_axes[axis];
675      }
676    } finally {
677      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
678    }
679
680    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
681        "Joystick axis "
682            + axis
683            + " on port "
684            + stick
685            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
686    return 0.0;
687  }
688
689  /**
690   * Get the state of a POV on the joystick.
691   *
692   * @param stick The joystick to read.
693   * @param pov The POV to read.
694   * @return the angle of the POV in degrees, or -1 if the POV is not pressed.
695   */
696  public static int getStickPOV(int stick, int pov) {
697    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
698      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
699    }
700    if (pov < 0 || pov >= HAL.kMaxJoystickPOVs) {
701      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick POV is out of range");
702    }
703
704    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
705    try {
706      if (pov < m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_count) {
707        return m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_povs[pov];
708      }
709    } finally {
710      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
711    }
712
713    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
714        "Joystick POV "
715            + pov
716            + " on port "
717            + stick
718            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
719    return -1;
720  }
721
722  /**
723   * The state of the buttons on the joystick.
724   *
725   * @param stick The joystick to read.
726   * @return The state of the buttons on the joystick.
727   */
728  public static int getStickButtons(final int stick) {
729    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
730      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
731    }
732
733    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
734    try {
735      return m_joystickButtons[stick].m_buttons;
736    } finally {
737      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
738    }
739  }
740
741  /**
742   * Returns the number of axes on a given joystick port.
743   *
744   * @param stick The joystick port number
745   * @return The number of axes on the indicated joystick
746   */
747  public static int getStickAxisCount(int stick) {
748    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
749      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
750    }
751
752    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
753    try {
754      return m_joystickAxes[stick].m_count;
755    } finally {
756      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
757    }
758  }
759
760  /**
761   * Returns the number of POVs on a given joystick port.
762   *
763   * @param stick The joystick port number
764   * @return The number of POVs on the indicated joystick
765   */
766  public static int getStickPOVCount(int stick) {
767    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
768      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
769    }
770
771    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
772    try {
773      return m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_count;
774    } finally {
775      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
776    }
777  }
778
779  /**
780   * Gets the number of buttons on a joystick.
781   *
782   * @param stick The joystick port number
783   * @return The number of buttons on the indicated joystick
784   */
785  public static int getStickButtonCount(int stick) {
786    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
787      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
788    }
789
790    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
791    try {
792      return m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count;
793    } finally {
794      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
795    }
796  }
797
798  /**
799   * Gets the value of isXbox on a joystick.
800   *
801   * @param stick The joystick port number
802   * @return A boolean that returns the value of isXbox
803   */
804  public static boolean getJoystickIsXbox(int stick) {
805    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
806      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
807    }
808
809    return HAL.getJoystickIsXbox((byte) stick) == 1;
810  }
811
812  /**
813   * Gets the value of type on a joystick.
814   *
815   * @param stick The joystick port number
816   * @return The value of type
817   */
818  public static int getJoystickType(int stick) {
819    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
820      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
821    }
822
823    return HAL.getJoystickType((byte) stick);
824  }
825
826  /**
827   * Gets the name of the joystick at a port.
828   *
829   * @param stick The joystick port number
830   * @return The value of name
831   */
832  public static String getJoystickName(int stick) {
833    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
834      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
835    }
836
837    return HAL.getJoystickName((byte) stick);
838  }
839
840  /**
841   * Returns the types of Axes on a given joystick port.
842   *
843   * @param stick The joystick port number
844   * @param axis The target axis
845   * @return What type of axis the axis is reporting to be
846   */
847  public static int getJoystickAxisType(int stick, int axis) {
848    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
849      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
850    }
851
852    return HAL.getJoystickAxisType((byte) stick, (byte) axis);
853  }
854
855  /**
856   * Returns if a joystick is connected to the Driver Station.
857   *
858   * <p>This makes a best effort guess by looking at the reported number of axis, buttons, and POVs
859   * attached.
860   *
861   * @param stick The joystick port number
862   * @return true if a joystick is connected
863   */
864  public static boolean isJoystickConnected(int stick) {
865    return getStickAxisCount(stick) > 0
866        || getStickButtonCount(stick) > 0
867        || getStickPOVCount(stick) > 0;
868  }
869
870  /**
871   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be enabled.
872   *
873   * @return True if the robot is enabled, false otherwise.
874   */
875  public static boolean isEnabled() {
876    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
877    try {
878      updateControlWord(false);
879      return m_controlWordCache.getEnabled() && m_controlWordCache.getDSAttached();
880    } finally {
881      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
882    }
883  }
884
885  /**
886   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be disabled.
887   *
888   * @return True if the robot should be disabled, false otherwise.
889   */
890  public static boolean isDisabled() {
891    return !isEnabled();
892  }
893
894  /**
895   * Gets a value indicating whether the Robot is e-stopped.
896   *
897   * @return True if the robot is e-stopped, false otherwise.
898   */
899  public static boolean isEStopped() {
900    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
901    try {
902      updateControlWord(false);
903      return m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
904    } finally {
905      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
906    }
907  }
908
909  /**
910   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
911   * autonomous mode.
912   *
913   * @return True if autonomous mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
914   */
915  public static boolean isAutonomous() {
916    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
917    try {
918      updateControlWord(false);
919      return m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
920    } finally {
921      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
922    }
923  }
924
925  /**
926   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
927   * autonomous mode and enabled.
928   *
929   * @return True if autonomous should be set and the robot should be enabled.
930   */
931  public static boolean isAutonomousEnabled() {
932    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
933    try {
934      updateControlWord(false);
935      return m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous() && m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
936    } finally {
937      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
938    }
939  }
940
941  /**
942   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
943   * operator-controlled mode.
944   *
945   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
946   */
947  public static boolean isTeleop() {
948    return !(isAutonomous() || isTest());
949  }
950
951  /**
952   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
953   * operator-controller mode and enabled.
954   *
955   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be set and the robot should be enabled.
956   */
957  public static boolean isTeleopEnabled() {
958    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
959    try {
960      updateControlWord(false);
961      return !m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous()
962          && !m_controlWordCache.getTest()
963          && m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
964    } finally {
965      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
966    }
967  }
968
969  /**
970   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in test
971   * mode.
972   *
973   * @return True if test mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
974   */
975  public static boolean isTest() {
976    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
977    try {
978      updateControlWord(false);
979      return m_controlWordCache.getTest();
980    } finally {
981      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
982    }
983  }
984
985  /**
986   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station is attached.
987   *
988   * @return True if Driver Station is attached, false otherwise.
989   */
990  public static boolean isDSAttached() {
991    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
992    try {
993      updateControlWord(false);
994      return m_controlWordCache.getDSAttached();
995    } finally {
996      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
997    }
998  }
999
1000  /**
1001   * Gets if a new control packet from the driver station arrived since the last time this function
1002   * was called.
1003   *
1004   * @return True if the control data has been updated since the last call.
1005   */
1006  public static boolean isNewControlData() {
1007    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1008    try {
1009      int currentCount = m_waitForDataCount;
1010      if (m_lastCount.get() != currentCount) {
1011        m_lastCount.set(currentCount);
1012        return true;
1013      }
1014    } finally {
1015      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1016    }
1017    return false;
1018  }
1019
1020  /**
1021   * Gets if the driver station attached to a Field Management System.
1022   *
1023   * @return true if the robot is competing on a field being controlled by a Field Management System
1024   */
1025  public static boolean isFMSAttached() {
1026    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1027    try {
1028      updateControlWord(false);
1029      return m_controlWordCache.getFMSAttached();
1030    } finally {
1031      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1032    }
1033  }

1037   *
1038   * @return the game specific message
1039   */

1043      return m_matchInfo.gameSpecificMessage;
1044    } finally {
1045      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1046    }
1047  }

1049  /**
1050   * Get the event name.
1051   *
1052   * @return the event name
1053   */
1054  public static String getEventName() {
1055    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1056    try {
1057      return m_matchInfo.eventName;
1058    } finally {
1059      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1060    }
1061  }
1062
1063  /**
1064   * Get the match type.
1065   *
1066   * @return the match type
1067   */
1068  public static MatchType getMatchType() {
1069    int matchType;
1070    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1071    try {
1072      matchType = m_matchInfo.matchType;
1073    } finally {
1074      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1075    }
1076    switch (matchType) {
1077      case 1:
1078        return MatchType.Practice;
1079      case 2:
1080        return MatchType.Qualification;
1081      case 3:
1082        return MatchType.Elimination;
1083      default:
1084        return MatchType.None;
1085    }
1086  }
1087

1089   * Get the match number.
1090   *
1091   * @return the match number
1092   */
1093  public static int getMatchNumber() {
1094    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1095    try {
1096      return m_matchInfo.matchNumber;
1097    } finally {
1098      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1099    }
1100  }

1102  /**
1103   * Get the replay number.
1104   *
1105   * @return the replay number
1106   */
1107  public static int getReplayNumber() {
1108    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1109    try {
1110      return m_matchInfo.replayNumber;
1111    } finally {
1112      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1113    }

1115
1116  /**
1117   * Get the current alliance from the FMS.
1118   *
1119   * @return the current alliance
1120   */
1121  public static Alliance getAlliance() {
1122    AllianceStationID allianceStationID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
1123    if (allianceStationID == null) {
1124      return Alliance.Invalid;
1125    }
1126
1127    switch (allianceStationID) {
1128      case Red1:
1129      case Red2:
1130      case Red3:
1131        return Alliance.Red;
1132
1133      case Blue1:
1134      case Blue2:
1135      case Blue3:
1136        return Alliance.Blue;
1137
1138      default:
1139        return Alliance.Invalid;
1140    }
1141  }
1142
1143  /**
1144   * Gets the location of the team's driver station controls.
1145   *
1146   * @return the location of the team's driver station controls: 1, 2, or 3
1147   */
1148  public static int getLocation() {
1149    AllianceStationID allianceStationID = HAL.getAllianceStation();
1150    if (allianceStationID == null) {
1151      return 0;
1152    }
1153    switch (allianceStationID) {
1154      case Red1:
1155      case Blue1:
1156        return 1;
1157
1158      case Red2:
1159      case Blue2:
1160        return 2;
1161
1162      case Blue3:
1163      case Red3:
1164        return 3;
1165
1166      default:
1167        return 0;
1168    }
1169  }
1170
1171  /**
1172   * Wait for new data from the driver station.
1173   *
1174   * <p>Checks if new control data has arrived since the last waitForData call on the current
1175   * thread. If new data has not arrived, returns immediately.
1176   */
1177  public static void waitForData() {
1178    waitForData(0);
1179  }
1180
1181  /**
1182   * Wait for new data or for timeout, which ever comes first. If timeout is 0, wait for new data
1183   * only.
1184   *
1185   * <p>Checks if new control data has arrived since the last waitForData call on the current
1186   * thread. If new data has not arrived, returns immediately.
1187   *
1188   * @param timeoutSeconds The maximum time in seconds to wait.
1189   * @return true if there is new data, otherwise false
1190   */
1191  public static boolean waitForData(double timeoutSeconds) {
1192    long startTimeMicroS = RobotController.getFPGATime();
1193    long timeoutMicroS = (long) (timeoutSeconds * 1e6);
1194    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1195    try {
1196      int currentCount = m_waitForDataCount;
1197      if (m_lastCount.get() != currentCount) {
1198        m_lastCount.set(currentCount);
1199        return true;
1200      }
1201      while (m_waitForDataCount == currentCount) {
1202        if (timeoutMicroS > 0) {
1203          long nowMicroS = RobotController.getFPGATime();
1204          if (nowMicroS < startTimeMicroS + timeoutMicroS) {
1205            // We still have time to wait
1206            boolean signaled =
1207                m_waitForDataCond.await(
1208                    startTimeMicroS + timeoutMicroS - nowMicroS, TimeUnit.MICROSECONDS);
1209            if (!signaled) {
1210              // Return false if a timeout happened
1211              return false;
1212            }
1213          } else {
1214            // Time has elapsed.
1215            return false;
1216          }
1217        } else {
1218          m_waitForDataCond.await();
1219        }
1220      }
1221      m_lastCount.set(m_waitForDataCount);
1222      // Return true if we have received a proper signal
1223      return true;
1224    } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1225      // return false on a thread interrupt
1226      Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1227      return false;
1228    } finally {
1229      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1230    }
1231  }
1232
1233  /**
1234   * Return the approximate match time. The FMS does not send an official match time to the robots,
1235   * but does send an approximate match time. The value will count down the time remaining in the
1236   * current period (auto or teleop). Warning: This is not an official time (so it cannot be used to
1237   * dispute ref calls or guarantee that a function will trigger before the match ends) The Practice
1238   * Match function of the DS approximates the behavior seen on the field.
1239   *
1240   * @return Time remaining in current match period (auto or teleop) in seconds
1241   */
1242  public static double getMatchTime() {
1243    return HAL.getMatchTime();
1244  }
1245
1246  /**
1247   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1248   * purposes only.
1249   *
1250   * @param entering If true, starting disabled code; if false, leaving disabled code
1251   */
1252  public static void inDisabled(boolean entering) {
1253    m_userInDisabled = entering;
1254  }
1255
1256  /**
1257   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1258   * purposes only.
1259   *
1260   * @param entering If true, starting autonomous code; if false, leaving autonomous code
1261   */
1262  public static void inAutonomous(boolean entering) {
1263    m_userInAutonomous = entering;
1264  }
1265
1266  /**
1267   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1268   * purposes only.
1269   *
1270   * @param entering If true, starting teleop code; if false, leaving teleop code
1271   */
1272  public static void inTeleop(boolean entering) {
1273    m_userInTeleop = entering;
1274  }
1275
1276  /**
1277   * Only to be used to tell the Driver Station what code you claim to be executing for diagnostic
1278   * purposes only.
1279   *
1280   * @param entering If true, starting test code; if false, leaving test code
1281   */
1282  public static void inTest(boolean entering) {
1283    m_userInTest = entering;
1284  }
1285
1286  /** Forces waitForData() to return immediately. */
1287  public static void wakeupWaitForData() {
1288    m_waitForDataMutex.lock();
1289    try {
1290      m_waitForDataCount++;
1291      m_waitForDataCond.signalAll();
1292    } finally {
1293      m_waitForDataMutex.unlock();
1294    }
1295  }
1296
1297  /**
1298   * Allows the user to specify whether they want joystick connection warnings to be printed to the
1299   * console. This setting is ignored when the FMS is connected -- warnings will always be on in
1300   * that scenario.
1301   *
1302   * @param silence Whether warning messages should be silenced.
1303   */
1304  public static void silenceJoystickConnectionWarning(boolean silence) {
1305    m_silenceJoystickWarning = silence;
1306  }
1307
1308  /**
1309   * Returns whether joystick connection warnings are silenced. This will always return false when
1310   * connected to the FMS.
1311   *
1312   * @return Whether joystick connection warnings are silenced.
1313   */
1314  public static boolean isJoystickConnectionWarningSilenced() {
1315    return !isFMSAttached() && m_silenceJoystickWarning;
1316  }
1317
1318  /**
1319   * Copy data from the DS task for the user. If no new data exists, it will just be returned,
1320   * otherwise the data will be copied from the DS polling loop.
1321   */
1322  protected static void getData() {
1323    // Get the status of all of the joysticks
1324    for (byte stick = 0; stick < kJoystickPorts; stick++) {
1325      m_joystickAxesCache[stick].m_count =
1326          HAL.getJoystickAxes(stick, m_joystickAxesCache[stick].m_axes);
1327      m_joystickPOVsCache[stick].m_count =
1328          HAL.getJoystickPOVs(stick, m_joystickPOVsCache[stick].m_povs);
1329      m_joystickButtonsCache[stick].m_buttons = HAL.getJoystickButtons(stick, m_buttonCountBuffer);
1330      m_joystickButtonsCache[stick].m_count = m_buttonCountBuffer.get(0);
1331    }
1332
1333    HAL.getMatchInfo(m_matchInfoCache);
1334
1335    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1336    try {
1337      // Force a control word update, to make sure the data is the newest.
1338      updateControlWord(true);
1339    } finally {
1340      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1341    }
1342
1343    DataLogSender dataLogSender;
1344    // lock joystick mutex to swap cache data
1345    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1346    try {
1347      for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
1348        // If buttons weren't pressed and are now, set flags in m_buttonsPressed
1349        m_joystickButtonsPressed[i] |=
1350            ~m_joystickButtons[i].m_buttons & m_joystickButtonsCache[i].m_buttons;
1351
1352        // If buttons were pressed and aren't now, set flags in m_buttonsReleased
1353        m_joystickButtonsReleased[i] |=
1354            m_joystickButtons[i].m_buttons & ~m_joystickButtonsCache[i].m_buttons;
1355      }
1356
1357      // move cache to actual data
1358      HALJoystickAxes[] currentAxes = m_joystickAxes;
1359      m_joystickAxes = m_joystickAxesCache;
1360      m_joystickAxesCache = currentAxes;
1361
1362      HALJoystickButtons[] currentButtons = m_joystickButtons;
1363      m_joystickButtons = m_joystickButtonsCache;
1364      m_joystickButtonsCache = currentButtons;
1365
1366      HALJoystickPOVs[] currentPOVs = m_joystickPOVs;
1367      m_joystickPOVs = m_joystickPOVsCache;
1368      m_joystickPOVsCache = currentPOVs;
1369
1370      MatchInfoData currentInfo = m_matchInfo;
1371      m_matchInfo = m_matchInfoCache;
1372      m_matchInfoCache = currentInfo;
1373
1374      dataLogSender = m_dataLogSender;
1375    } finally {
1376      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1377    }
1378
1379    wakeupWaitForData();
1380    m_matchDataSender.sendMatchData();
1381    if (dataLogSender != null) {
1382      dataLogSender.send(WPIUtilJNI.now());
1383    }
1384  }
1385
1386  /**
1387   * Reports errors related to unplugged joysticks Throttles the errors so that they don't overwhelm
1388   * the DS.
1389   */
1390  private static void reportJoystickUnpluggedError(String message) {
1391    double currentTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
1392    if (currentTime > m_nextMessageTime) {
1393      reportError(message, false);
1394      m_nextMessageTime = currentTime + JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL;
1395    }
1396  }
1397
1398  /**
1399   * Reports errors related to unplugged joysticks Throttles the errors so that they don't overwhelm
1400   * the DS.
1401   */
1402  private static void reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(String message) {
1403    if (isFMSAttached() || !m_silenceJoystickWarning) {
1404      double currentTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
1405      if (currentTime > m_nextMessageTime) {
1406        reportWarning(message, false);
1407        m_nextMessageTime = currentTime + JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL;
1408      }
1409    }
1410  }
1411
1412  /** Provides the service routine for the DS polling m_thread. */
1413  private static void run() {
1414    int safetyCounter = 0;
1415    while (m_threadKeepAlive) {
1416      HAL.waitForDSData();
1417      getData();
1418
1419      if (isDisabled()) {
1420        safetyCounter = 0;
1421      }
1422
1423      safetyCounter++;
1424      if (safetyCounter >= 4) {
1425        MotorSafety.checkMotors();
1426        safetyCounter = 0;
1427      }
1428      if (m_userInDisabled) {
1429        HAL.observeUserProgramDisabled();
1430      }
1431      if (m_userInAutonomous) {
1432        HAL.observeUserProgramAutonomous();
1433      }
1434      if (m_userInTeleop) {
1435        HAL.observeUserProgramTeleop();
1436      }
1437      if (m_userInTest) {
1438        HAL.observeUserProgramTest();
1439      }
1440    }
1441  }
1442
1443  /**
1444   * Forces a control word cache update, and update the passed in control word.
1445   *
1446   * @param word Word to update.
1447   */
1448  public static void updateControlWordFromCache(ControlWord word) {
1449    m_controlWordMutex.lock();
1450    try {
1451      updateControlWord(true);
1452      word.update(m_controlWordCache);
1453    } finally {
1454      m_controlWordMutex.unlock();
1455    }
1456  }
1457
1458  /**
1459   * Updates the data in the control word cache. Updates if the force parameter is set, or if 50ms
1460   * have passed since the last update.
1461   *
1462   * <p>Must be called with m_controlWordMutex lock held.
1463   *
1464   * @param force True to force an update to the cache, otherwise update if 50ms have passed.
1465   */
1466  private static void updateControlWord(boolean force) {
1467    long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
1468    if (now - m_lastControlWordUpdate > 50 || force) {
1469      HAL.getControlWord(m_controlWordCache);
1470      m_lastControlWordUpdate = now;
1471    }
1472  }
1473
1474  /**
1475   * Starts logging DriverStation data to data log. Repeated calls are ignored.
1476   *
1477   * @param log data log
1478   * @param logJoysticks if true, log joystick data
1479   */
1480  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.NonThreadSafeSingleton")
1481  public static void startDataLog(DataLog log, boolean logJoysticks) {
1482    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1483    try {
1484      if (m_dataLogSender == null) {
1485        m_dataLogSender = new DataLogSender(log, logJoysticks, WPIUtilJNI.now());
1486      }
1487    } finally {
1488      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1489    }
1490  }
1491
1492  /**
1493   * Starts logging DriverStation data to data log, including joystick data. Repeated calls are
1494   * ignored.
1495   *
1496   * @param log data log
1497   */
1498  public static void startDataLog(DataLog log) {
1499    startDataLog(log, true);
1500  }
1501}
